Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Surgical Ventricular Reconstruction in Coronary Artery Disease

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to either CABG alone or CABG plus SVR.

Participants.evidence: patients with coronary artery disease and left ventricular dysfunction

Intervention.evidence: randomised to either CABG alone or CABG plus SVR

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was mortality or cardiac hospitalization over a 3-year period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted centrally, with allocation concealment ensured.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised controlled trial included 1,000 patients

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: At 3 years, there was no significant difference in mortality or the combined outcome of death or cardiac hospitalization

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.
